articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Air India plane headed to London with 242 people on board crashed minutes after taking off from India's western city of Ahmedabad on Thursday, the airline and police said, without specifying whether there were any fatalities.
articles.title: Air India plane with 242 on board crashes at India's Ahmedabad airport

articles.author: Ahmed Rasheed, Daphne Psaledakis
articles.description: The United States is preparing to evacuate its Iraqi embassy due to heightened security risks in the region, three U.S. and two Iraqi sources said on Wednesday while a U.S. official said military dependents could also leave Bahrain.
articles.title: US preparing to evacuate embassy in Iraq over security risks, sources say

articles.author: Brad Brooks, Sandra Strojanovic
articles.description: California will face off with Washington in court on Thursday over President Donald Trump's deployment of U.S. troops in Los Angeles after demonstrators again took to the streets in major cities to protest Trump's immigration crackdown.
articles.title: Marines prepare for Los Angeles deployment as protests spread across US

articles.author: Max Schwarz, Alexandra Schwarz-Goerlich
articles.description: Austrian investigators were on Thursday slowly piecing together the character of the man who carried out the country's worst school shooting this week, with officials struggling to reach anyone who knew the deceased 21-year-old well.
articles.title: Austrian investigators slowly build profile of school shooter

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli troops entered southwestern Syria in the early hours of Thursday and arrested several people who the Israeli military said were members of Palestinian militant group Hamas but which Syria's interior ministry said were civilians.
articles.title: Israeli military says it arrested Hamas members in Syria

articles.author: Jana Choukeir, Ahmed Elimam
articles.description: The sixth round of U.S.-Iran nuclear talks will be held on Sunday in Muscat, the Omani foreign minister said on Thursday, after U.S. President Donald Trump reiterated that Tehran would not be allowed to have a nuclear weapon.
articles.title: Oman confirms next round of US-Iran nuclear talks amid fears of regional risks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Lynne Tracy, the U.S. ambassador to Russia, will soon leave her post, her embassy said on Thursday, after serving through one of the most tense and difficult periods in relations between Moscow and Washington.
articles.title: U.S. ambassador to Russia to leave post soon, says embassy

articles.author: Felix Light
articles.description: Nightfall is an anxious time for residents of Khnatsakh.
articles.title: In Armenia, rising ceasefire violations bring fears of war with Azerbaijan

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain is monitoring the situation in the Middle East but has no update on staffing in the region, a spokesperson for Prime Minister Keir Starmer said on Thursday after the United States announced it was moving some personnel due to security concerns.
articles.title: UK is monitoring Middle East situation, no update on staffing - PM's spokesperson
Indonesia invites foreign stakes in $80 bln seawall to shield coasts from floods
